page.title: 17Education:Trekenner School
page.content: {Trekenner CP School}was opened in 1876 as Lezant Board School with over 100 pupils.At present there are 58 pupils, divided into three classes.The two junior classes,taught by Mr.Crispin (headteacher) and Mrs.Bratton,occupy the original building while the infants,taught by Mrs.Barnes,occupy an Elliott hut.The school house is now used for a library,TV and cookery,stockroom and office.The Parish Field next to the school is rented for use as a playing field. Meals are cooked on the premises. During 1984/85 Trekenner School pupils have been working with children from three other primary schools (Coads Green,Lewannick and South Petherwin).There has been a combined musical,teacher exchanges,sports afternoons and a swimming gala.
